speaker: FARRADAY
line: When I began our field research here, these frogs were thriving. Since then, the adult population's dropped to fewer than 200. If you don't take protective measures, in a few years, the perenhis cenesaphelo will be extinct here.

speaker: BAILEY
line: Frog populations are declining all over the globe, Dr Farraday. No one knows why. You can't possibly place them all on the endangered species list.

speaker: FARRADAY
line: You'd find a way for the cute, furry little mammals we were talking about.

speaker: BAILEY
line: Regardless, your study remains inconclusive. Speculative at best. You've provided no concrete evidence that frog depopulation is the exclusive result of human impeachment.

speaker: FARRADAY
line: A frog holocaust is currently being executed Dr Bailey and man is the executioner.

speaker: BAILEY
line: You're the biologist Dr Farraday. You've never heard of survival of the fittest? .

speaker: FARRADAY
line: Don't forget that rule also applies to mankind. You can't turn your back on nature, or nature will turn her back on you!

speaker: BAILEY
line: Damn it, where could it be.... .

speaker: SCULLY
line: Nature's calling. I think we should pull over soon.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you really have to bring that thing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You wake me up on a Saturday morning, tell me to be ready in five minutes, my mother is out of town, all of the dog sitters are booked, and you know how I feel about kennels. So unless you want to lose your security deposit on the car, I suggest you pull over.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think I'm lost anyway. I've got to stop and ask for directions.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know I'm lost as to why you're so interested in this missing persons case.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dr Bailey works for the US Forestry Service. That makes his disappearance a federal case.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's not jurisdiction that I'm questioning, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dr Bailey's not the first person to go missing from Heuvelman's Lake recently. Two weeks ago, a Boy Scout Troop was out here, fox hunting, their troop leader wandered off to relieve himself, and hasn't been seen or heard from since.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So you think that there's a serial killer at large?

speaker: MULDER
line: The operative word being large.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you leaving out?

speaker: MULDER
line: What makes you think I'm leaving anything out?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Most missing persons cases are not that uncommon, Mulder. Why this one warrants us flying halfway across the country and driving for two hours is a total mystery. . Oh, tell me you're not serious?

speaker: SCULLY
line: According to the Sheriff's report, you were the last person to see Dr Bailey alive.

speaker: FARRADAY
line: That's what they tell me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I understand you argued over an endangered species petition.

speaker: FARRADAY
line: Bailey was the worst kind of hypocrite. Closest he ever came to commuting with nature was subscribing to National Geographic.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You sound bitter, Dr Farraday.

speaker: FARRADAY
line: Of course I'm bitter. The man wrote off three years of carefully collected data in a two hour inspection, which doesn't mean I plotted his demise. Well, that is what you are suggesting, isn't it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, aside from having a motive, you don't seem too upset by any of this.

speaker: FARRADAY
line: You expect me to cry for one man when an entire species is perched on the brink of extinction?

speaker: MULDER
line: Dr Farraday, you know the wildlife living around this lake just as well as anybody, don't you?

speaker: FARRADAY
line: I'd say that's accurate.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you aware of any indigenous species that's capable of attacking a human being?

speaker: FARRADAY
line: Yes. Another human being.

speaker: MULDER
line: Aside from that, is there a creature that comes to mind...

speaker: FARRADAY
line: Has anyone ever told you two you have a great problem coming to the point?

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay then. In your work have you come across any evidence that lends support to the existance of this creature they call Big Blue?

speaker: FARRADAY
line: See, this is what always happens. This is how it starts.

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: FARRADAY
line: The deflection, sleight of hand. See, whenever an issue requires any real thought, any serious mental effort, people turn to UFO's, and sea serpents and sasquatch. Afternoon talk shows and tabloid TV. They've reduced our attention span to the length of a sound byte. So that soon our ability to think will be as extinct as a ranas sanasephela frog.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll take that rambling diatribe to mean that you don't believe in the existance of such a creature.

speaker: FARRADAY
line: I'm not even going to grace that statement with a reply.

speaker: MULDER
line: A prehistoric animal living in a lake is not without presidence. Last August they pulled a Bull shark from Lake Onaga in Massasteuchusts.

speaker: FARRADAY
line: An anomaly. Which proves nothing. It only serves as fodder for psuedo-scientists with nothing better to do than chase fairy tales. Excuse me.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's been reported for centuries in dozens of countries. From the monsters in Loch Ness, Nessie, to the Ogopogo in Lake Okonagan.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And Lake Champagne, Lalavack Iceland...

speaker: MULDER
line: Sounds like you know a little something about the subject.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I did as a kid. But, then I grew up, and became a scientist.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well some very grown up crypto-zoologist believed it could be an evolutionary throwback, quite possibly prehistoric.

speaker: SCULLY

speaker: MULDER
line: A pleosaur, acutualluy. Though admittedly, there's not a lot of hard evidence to back that up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know why? Because those creatures don't exist, Mulder. They're folk tales born out of some collective fear of the unknown.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well how many folk tales do you know that could eat a boy scout leader and a biologist?

speaker: MULDER
line: Check this out, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It looks like an insect casing or Scarab or something from a beetle.

speaker: TED
line: Can I help you people?

speaker: MULDER
line: We're looking for the Lake View Cabins. Flipper Road?

speaker: TED
line: You passed the turnoff a few miles back. It's uh, pretty tough to find. Uh, a map might help. Uh, they're two-fifty each, plus Uncle Sam.

speaker: MULDER
line: Fine.

speaker: TED
line: If you don't mind my saying, you folks don't look like you're here for the trout.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, we're with the FBI. We're investingating a pair of missing persons reports.

speaker: TED
line: Oh, yeah. It's big news around here. Everyone's been talking about it.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are they saying?

speaker: TED
line: The same thing they've been saying for years. Now I'm not one for spreading rumours, but the truth is, I've heard the story since I was a kid.

speaker: MULDER
line: About Big Blue? What kind of stories?

speaker: TED
line: Well, I was ten years old. Fishing with my daddy, when I heard a... big commotion. Clear across the lake. A wailing sound, the likes of which I had never heard before, never heard since. My daddy told me later that a cow had escaped from the Rockdale ranch and was drinking by the lake. When, old Big Blue came right up and snatched her from the bank.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's quite a story.

speaker: TED
line: That's just one.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Those stories must sell a lot of T-shirts.

speaker: TED
line: Well, a man's gotta survive.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about you? Do you believe those stories?

speaker: TED
line: Well, a man's got to look at the evidence, decide for himself. But if you want to ask a real expert, should probably talk to Ansel here. He's out there practically every day. . It was his daddy's cow that got eaten.

speaker: ANSEL
line: Can you get these developed by tomorrow, Ted? And another five rolls while I'm in town?

speaker: TED
line: These folks are with the FBI, they've been looking into that unsolved mystery about how those two people disappeared.

speaker: ANSEL
line: Unsolved mystery? Since when is there a mystery?

speaker: MULDER
line: So you think Big Blue's responsible for what's been happening?

speaker: ANSEL
line: Don't you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Have you ever actually seen it?

speaker: ANSEL
line: Not directly, no. But I aim to. Someday, I'll be in the right place at the right time, and I will snap a shot of that monster.

speaker: ANSEL
line: nan

speaker: TED
line: Now if you hit Striker's cove, you've gone too far.

speaker: ANSEL
line: Call the Sheriff. We've got a floater.

line: It's Scout Woolsley. The boy scout troop leader.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, his fly's undone.

line: Are you insinuating something?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, most drowning victims are found with high levels of alchohol in their blood and their fly's unzipped. While urinating over the sides of boats, docks or whatever, they lose their balance, fall in and drown.

speaker: MULDER
line: Still doesn't explain why half of him is still missing. Looks to me like something took a big bite.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe not so big.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you mean?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, fish eat decomposing matter, any body that 's been suspended in this environment for a period of time is going to become a food source. We eat fish, and fish eat us.

speaker: MULDER
line: But are fish also known for eating half and saving half for later?

speaker: ANSEL
line: Like I said, I recognize his hat.

speaker: MULDER
line: How could you not?

speaker: ANSEL
line: So Ted's Ford is parked about a half a mile back. Here's his hat, and here's these tracks. Know what I'm saying? I mean, look at the size of these tracks.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? This is Sheriff Lance Heads.

speaker: MULDER
line: Careful, watch out where you're walking. Watch out...watch out for those tracks.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Queequeg.

speaker: SHERIFF
line: Ansel, why don't you go check the woods?

speaker: ANSEL
line: Today's the day. I'm going to get him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Any sign of Ted Bertram?

speaker: SHERIFF
line: No. And I'm not jumping to any conclusions either. Speaking of which, what's this I hear about you wanting to close the lake?

speaker: MULDER
line: Just until we figure out what's going on here.

speaker: SHERIFF
line: I think I can tell you what's going on. Same thing that goes on every year. Fishermen get drunk, they drown, men get run over by power boats. Hell, on a lake this size, you're going to have eight, nine deaths in a season. That's just statistical fact.

speaker: MULDER
line: But you've got two or three in as many weeks, I'd say you're a little outside your bell curve, Sheriff.

speaker: SHERIFF
line: Agent Mulder? Mulder, this lake has 48 miles of shoreline. I got four deputies full time. To close down a lake this size, hell, you'd have to call out the National Guard something like that...

speaker: SCULLY
line: We'd need irrefutable proof.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about these tracks?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, a creature as large as the one you're looking for would have left considerably deeper impressions. Queeqeg! Queequeg come back here! Queequeg! Mulder? Sherrif, come take a look at this.

speaker: SHERIFF
line: What you got?

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's your lake monster Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's what it looks like.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's all a hoax?

speaker: SHERIFF
line: I'll be dammed.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but what happened to the hoaxer?

speaker: DUDE
line: Saw this, you know on the Discovery Channel? They got like this, you know, cult built up around these toads. The skin's got these, hallucionogenic properties. Lets you see all these visions. It's really spiritual.

speaker: CHICK
line: Yeah? I don't know.

speaker: DUDE
line: It's 'sposed to take the doors of perception, and swing them so wide open, you know, plus you get to see all these cool streaks and trails and crap.

speaker: CHICK
line: Well? Are you sure that's even a toad?

speaker: DUDE
line: Dude, what's wrong with you? You made me drop my toad.

speaker: DIVER
line: It's okay, man. I'll get you another one.

speaker: DUDE
line: How long till we get down to Lauderdale? Oh, no.. Dude?

line: Well, if this is a hoax, it's quite elaborate.

speaker: SHERIFF
line: I got zip out of Freebird and Moon Unit over there, there's no telling what they're been smoking. What's it looking like?

line: Well, it's hard to tell without an autopsy, but it looks like propellor damage from a motor boat.

speaker: SHERIFF
line: Well, this is a designated boating area!

speaker: MULDER
line: Twenty feet from shore, and twice in one day?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, look at it out there. It's like rush hour.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about Ted Bertram?

speaker: SCULLY
line: For all we know, he stepped in something and bled into those funny shoes of his. He's probably so embarrased right now, he doesn't want to show his face.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, is that the psychological approach to crime solving? He's too embarrased?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Regardless of what I believe, there's no hard evidence to what you believe.

speaker: ANSEL
line: Crap!

speaker: MULDER
line: This roll's been exposed, can you get that developed? That's three in one day, Sheriff. All this driving from crime scene to crime scene's giving me highway hypnosis. Close down the lake.

speaker: SHERIFF
line: I tell you, it ain't that simple. I just ain't got the manpower. Further more, I'm not at all convinced we're dealing with an acquatic menace.

line: He's right, Mulder. Those two sets of remains we found so far are inconclusive. We really need to find this body.

speaker: SHERIFF
line: My thoughts exactly, ma'am. If you just give us a couple more minutes... whoa!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you okay, Sheriff?

speaker: SHERIFF
line: Something brushed up against me out there. Close the lake! Close it down! I want you call the state police, and the Wildlife, Fish and Game! You tell them we got an emergency situation!

speaker: SCULLY
line: I agree with you, I just wish that he gave us something more.

speaker: MULDER
line: Look at this, could this be a tooth?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, it could be a lot of things, Mulder. Fifteen years of fruitless hinting and the only thing the guy comes up with is a blurry picture of the monster's tooth?

speaker: MULDER
line: There's thousands of pictures here, Scully. There's got to be some evidence here somewhere. Take a look at these.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, they're just a bunch of poorly composed tory shots.

speaker: MULDER
line: That could be something.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A tooth? I'm taking Queequeg for a walk.

speaker: MULDER
line: Want me to come with you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm fine. Goodnight, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Goodnight, I'll see you in the morning.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Come on, Queequeg. Queequeg, we're not going to go into the woods. Come on, do your business. I thought you had to go. Queequeg! What is it? Queequeg! Where are you going? Queequeg! Come back here! Queequeg! Queequeg? Queequeg! Quee...

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sorry about Queequeg. You know, I think I've learned something from these photos.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: They're not pictures of the lake monster, they're pictures of the lake. Locations where the fish has been sighted over the past several years. Look, five years ago, all the sightings occured in the centre of the lake. But progressively the sightings have moved closer and closer to shore, until this year, they're practically on the shore.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Could you repeat the last part again? I kind of faded out.

speaker: MULDER
line: Which part?

speaker: SCULLY
line: After you said I'm sorry?

speaker: MULDER
line: Can you drive a boat?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's too bad we're not out here fishing.

speaker: MULDER
line: We are fishing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You really expect to find this thing, don't you Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: You want to head right...here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'll take that as a yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know the difference between expectation and hope. Seek and ye shall find, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know, on the old mariner's maps, the cartographers would designate uncharted territories by writing 'Here Be Monsters'.

speaker: MULDER
line: I got a map of New York City just like that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What was that?

speaker: MULDER
line: It ain't low gas.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is that? What is that, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Here be monsters, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It looks like it's coming straight at us.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yep, that's what it looks like.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mayday! Mayday! Can anybody hear me? This is the Patricia Rae. CA78327. Mayday! Mayday!

speaker: SCULLY
line: There goes our five hundred dollar deposit.

speaker: MULDER
line: I say we swim to shore.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Swim?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, the shore can't be too far from here.

line: When you're living in the city you forget that night is actually so...dark.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Living in the city you forget a lot of things. You know what I was just thinking about, being mugged or hit by a car, It's not until you get back to nature that you realize that everything is out to get you. So my father always told me to respect nature, because it has no respect for you.

speaker: MULDER
line: That was him Scully, that was Big Blue.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So what if it was. Mulder, what are we doing here?

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you mean, what are we doing here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you hoping to accomplish?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, some of the things that we investigate are so intangible but this creature it exists within the specific earthly confines of this lake, and I want to find it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What for?

speaker: MULDER
line: You're a scientist, why do you ask that question? I mean, it would be a marvelous discovery, it could revolutionize our evolutionary biological thinking.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is that really the reason why? You know when you showed me those pictures the photographer took, you want to know what I really saw in them?

speaker: MULDER
line: A tooth?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, you. That man is your future. Listening only to himself, hoping to catch a glimpse of the truth, for who knows what reason.

speaker: MULDER
line: I heard him joke that he was hoping to live off the copyrights fees of a genuine Big Blue photo.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, as dumb as it sounds, at least it's a legitimate reason.

line: You don't think my reasons are legitimate?

line: Mulder, sometimes I just can't figure them out.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm still tempted to fire. Hey Scully, you think you could ever cannibalize someone? I mean if you really had to.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well as much as the very idea is abhorrent to me, I suppose under certain conditions a living entity is practically conditioned to perform whatever extreme measures are necessary to ensure its survival. I suppose I'm no different.

speaker: MULDER
line: You've lost some weight recently haven't you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, actually I have, thanks for...

speaker: MULDER
line: Though it is amazing what some animals will do to guarantee the continuation of a species isn't it? A creature of this size must have adapted its behavior over the years to minimize its chances of being seen by its only predator, us. Its coming closer to shore must have been an act of desperation on its part.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Poor Queequeg.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why did you name your dog Queequeg?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It was the name of the harpoonist in Moby Dick. My father used to read to me from Moby Dick when I was a little girl, I called him Ahab and he called me Starbuck. So I named my dog Queequeg. It's funny, I just realized something.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's a bizarre name for a dog, huh?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, how much you're like Ahab. You're so consumed by your personal vengeance against life, whether it be its inherent cruelties or mysteries, everything takes on a warped significance to fit your megalomaniacal cosmology.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, are you coming on to me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's the truth or a white whale. What difference does it make? I mean, both obsessions are impossible to capture, and trying to do so will only leave you dead along with everyone else you bring with you. You know Mulder, you are Ahab.

speaker: MULDER
line: You know, its interesting you should say that, because I've always wanted a peg leg. It's a boyhood thing I never grew out of. I'm not being flippant, I've given this a lot of thought. I mean. if you have a peg leg or hooks for hands then maybe its enough to simply keep on living. You know, braving facing life with your disability. But without these things you're actually meant to make something of your life, achieve something earn a raise, wear a necktie. So if anything I'm actually the antithesis of Ahab, because if I did have a peg leg I'd quite possibly be more happy and more content not to be chasing after these creatures of the unknown.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And that's not flippant?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, flippant is my favourite line from Moby Dick. 'Hell is an idea first born on an undigested apple dumpling', huh?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What was that?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know, but it ain't no duck.

speaker: FARRADAY
line: I thought I heard voices. what are you two doing out here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr Farraday?

speaker: FARRADAY
line: Hope I'm not interrupting anything.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, no. we had a little trouble with our boat.

speaker: MULDER
line: Actually it sank.

speaker: FARRADAY
line: How'd that happen?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It was my fault. We would have been out here all night if you hadn't answered our distress call.

speaker: FARRADAY
line: Oh, I didn't. I was walking by, I heard you talking.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Walking by?

speaker: FARRADAY
line: Yeah, the shore is just a stone's throw from here. Come on, I'll take you back. It's just out of fuel. The sherrif will be around in a couple of minutes. I'd do it myself, but I've got work to do.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What exactly is it that you're doing out here Dr Farraday? It's well after midnight.

speaker: FARRADAY
line: Night is the ranas panasephalas's most active period, and this is its primary breeding ground. Or at least it used to be. Thousands of eggs used to cling to these reeds, beautiful jelly clusters. Now one must turn over many a leaf in order to find potential offspring.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's in the sack?

speaker: FARRADAY
line: Adult frogs, I've been breeding them in captivity, and releasing them into the wild.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is Striker's Cove?

speaker: MULDER
line: The frogs.

speaker: FARRADAY
line: I beg your pardon?

speaker: MULDER
line: The unexplained depletion of frogs originates from this cove. It's the food chain.

speaker: FARRADAY
line: What about it?

speaker: MULDER
line: Food chain. If you alter one life form in an ecosystem, the rest is necessarily affected, either by an increase or decrease. So if an aquatic dinosaur's diet consisted primarily of frogs, then if those frogs suddenly became scarce, it would have to search for an alternative food source.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A human?

speaker: FARRADAY
line: Agent Mulder, you are taking my legitimate research and basic biological principle, and stretching them both way out of proportion, in an effort to give some kind of validity to an entirely ludicrous theory. There is no prehistoric lake monster.

speaker: MULDER
line: This creature lives here in this cove. That explains the disappearance of these frogs, for which you have no explanation, ludicrous or not. As well as the recent human attacks.

speaker: FARRADAY
line: That's crazy. If something was living in these waters, you don't think I would have seen it? I've been conducting research here for three years.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm talking about a prehistoric creature that's gone unnoticed for virtually thousands of years. If it knows how do anything, it knows how to hide. They say that the Loch Ness monster doesn't even live in the water, that it lives in the surrounding cliffs. Maybe Big Blue has an inland habitat, somewhere in the rocks, or in this dense forest here.

speaker: FARRADAY
line: I have no time for these absurdities. If you'll exuse me, I have some amphibians to release.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well captain, what now?

speaker: SHERIFF
line: Agent Scully! Agent Mulder! Tehre's been another death, and this time it does appear to be some kind of animal. Bit a fisherman's arm clear off.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where'd this happen?

speaker: SHERIFF
line: On the other side of the lake, a couple of hours ago. My department has the cooperation of the state police, plus the full use of all the Wildlife, Fish and Game's department vessels, and I've got a full scale search already under way.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, we need those men here, searching this cove and these woods.

speaker: SHERIFF
line: But I got thirty boats on the water already, now if we're going to capture this thing...

speaker: MULDER
line: Sweep this cove. It's here in Striker's cove.

speaker: SHERIFF
line: The boats are searching the area of the latest attack, and I'm not going to move them. Now if you're going to waste your time, conducting a search of these woods, you go right ahead. I got me a lake monster to catch.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sheriff, Agent Mulder and I would appreciate it if you could spare two or three of your men to assist us here.

speaker: SHERIFF
line: Alright, I'll send them on down.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thanks.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What was that?

speaker: MULDER
line: Dr Farraday. What happened?

speaker: FARRADAY
line: Something grabbed my leg.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you see it?

speaker: FARRADAY
line: It came from behind me. Before I knew it it had me. Moved me back and forth. Then it just let go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think you nipped an artery. We've got to get him to a hospital, he's losing blood. Give me your belt.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where'd it go?

speaker: FARRADAY
line: I didn't see it, I didn't see it. It went through those reeds there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, help is coming. Mulder!

speaker: SHERIFF
line: All right, go ahead.

speaker: MULDER
line: How's Dr Farraday?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He'll be fine. How are you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm fine.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, you slued the big white whale, Ahab.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but I still don't have that peg leg.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How can you be disappointed? That alligator would have gone through half the local population if you hadn't killed it.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know. I guess I just wanted Big Blue to be real. I guess I see hope in such a possibility.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, there's still hope. That's why these missing stories have endured. People want to believe.
